description:
Across the Fiore kingdom, wizards join guilds and make their pay by filling magical needs—but one guild has a reputation as the roughest, rowdiest, most dangerous of all: Fairy Tail!
When four young Fairy Tail members unite, their bond is forged by a power found in neither muscle nor magic and grows stronger with every mission. Whatever you do, don't mess with these friends or you'll get a taste of Natsu's flaming fist or Gray's ice hammer, suffer a painful blow from one of Lucy's celestial spirits or catch the edge of Erza's mighty blade! Whether they're stopping demons from devastating the world or wrestling in the mess hall, this mystical team manages to inflict as much damage to their rivals as they do to the surrounding area!

(Source: Funimation)
synonyms: แฟรี่เทล ศึกจอมเวทอภินิหาร

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Fairy Tale
tags.description: This work tells a fairy tale, centers around fairy tales, or is based on a classic fairy tale.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Large Breasts
tags.description: Features a character with larger-than-average breasts.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Astronomy
tags.description: Relating or centered around the study of celestial objects and phenomena, space, or the universe.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

node.description:
__Blood Type:__ A
__Height:__ 157 cm (5'2")
__Hobby:__ Collecting records, watching professional wrestling
__Agency:__ Stay Luck

[Profile](https://stay-luck.com/talent/nakajima-megumi) | [Website](https://nakajima-megumi.jp) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mamegu_staff) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCkOGw3UbTMkj8U0VYzdmi5A) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/24277.html)

Born of a Japanese father and a Filipino mother, Megumi was brought up in a "house filled with music" and grew up with the desire to sing.  In 2003, she participated in the "Self Stardust Promotion" contest and passed, thereby affiliating her to the agency. In 2007, she auditioned to the Victor Entertainment sanctioned "Victor Vocal & Voice Audition" and won the role to voice Ranka Lee in Macross Frontier.  She is also the voice provider for the Vocaloid, [Megpoid](https://anilist.co/staff/140519).

She is affiliated with Stay Luck for voice acting and FlyingDog for singing.

**[Blog](http://ameblo.jp/shimokawa-mikuni/)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mikunituu)**

Mikuni Shimokawa is a pop singer and songwriter. She is best known for her songs used for theme music, particularly the opening and ending themes of [Full Metal Panic!](https://anilist.co/anime/71/Full-Metal-Panic/staff). In addition to her vocal talents, Shimokawa can also play the piano. She's a former member of the girl group Checkicco.

Shimokawa is currently married to [Tsuyoshi Koyama](https://anilist.co/staff/95285/Tsuyoshi-Koyama). The two were wed on Valentine's Day in 2012.

(Source: Wikipedia, edited)

[Profile](http://power-rise.jp/ono_ryoko.html) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/ryoko-ono/) | [Twitter 1](https://twitter.com/ono_ryoko) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/nazuna_gogyo) | [Twitter 3](https://twitter.com/ricca_kitami) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ry%C5%8Dko_Ono)

She is a voice actress and currently a freelancer.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiro_mashima)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCQLYbIvGWtClestisnB1_6A)__

Japanese manga artist most known for his manga Groove Adventure Rave, published by Kodansha's Weekly Shonen Magazine, from 1999 to 2005. The series was later adapted into an anime. However, the anime adaption was cancelled before it could complete the series.

In 2003, he collected some of his one-shot titles in two volumes: Mashima-en- Vol.1 & 2. Those stories include, among others, Cocona, "Xmas Hearts" and "Fairy Tail", a sort of prototype for his last work.

In 2006, he began his now finished series, Fairy Tail, serialized in Kodansha's Weekly Shonen Magazine. He also published the manga Monster Hunter Orage.

Hiro Mashima was a notable guest at the 2008 San Diego Comic-Con. He has one daughter.

His artwork and [Oda Eiichiro](https://anilist.co/staff/96881/EiichiroOda)'s are greatly similar, but that is due to both of them being influenced largely by [Toriyama Akira](https://anilist.co/staff/96901/AkiraToriyama)'s work growing up.

His former assistant was [Yoshikawa Miki](https://anilist.co/staff/98703/MikiYoshikawa) author of Yankee-kun to Megane-chan.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nassy_takanashi) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nassy_takanashi/) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/64mecceQewFCKwCK6JBW0o)

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/志茂文彦) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fumihiko_Shimo)

Noted for writing the scripts for Kyoto Animation's anime adaptations of Key visual novels.

Began his career as a production assistant on [Grave of the Fireflies](https://anilist.co/anime/578/), but switched to writing right after.

__Debut Date:__ March 14, 2001  

W-inds is a Japanese pop boy band managed by Vision Factory and signed to the Pony Canyon label since 2000. The group consists of Ryohei Chiba and Keita Tachibana; Ryuichi Ogata left the group in 2020. Tachibana is the lead singer of the group, while Chiba and Ogata provide backing vocals and rap.

__Members:__
• Ryohei Chiba (千葉涼平) born November 18, 1984 in Sapporo, Japan — Rapper, background singer, dancer
• Keita Tachibana (橘慶太) born December 16, 1985 in Fukuoka, Japan — Vocalist and dancer

__Former Members:__
• Ryuuichi Ogata (緒方龍一) born December 17, 1985  in Sapporo, Japan — Rapper, background singer, dancer

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dmpmutation)

**Shinji Ishihira** is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.

edges.role: Music (ep 114 ("Piano Concerto No. 2 in C minor, Op. 18")

node.description: Sergei Vasilievich Rachmaninoff was a Russian composer, pianist, and conductor. Rachmaninoff is widely considered one of the finest pianists of his day and, as a composer, one of the last great representatives of Romanticism in Russian classical music.
Originating from [Oh! Production](https://anilist.co/studio/234/).

Watarirouka Hashiritai (Corridor Running Team) is a Japanese female idol group, and a subgroup of Japanese female idol group AKB48. Under Pony Canyon, the group debuted in January 2009 with the double A-side single "Hatsukoi Dash/Aoi Mirai."

SuG is a Japanese rock band that formed in 2006. They are also part of the visual kei movement of Japan. The band has released two EPs, two full-length studio albums, and several singles. Until 2009, the band was signed to "Indie PSC", a subdivision of PS Company. As of 2010, they have signed onto a major label, Pony Canyon, and joined the forefront of major bands on PS Company. On October 7th, 2012, SuG announced they would officially leave PSC after their performance on December 29th, resulting in a temporary hiatus.  Members: Takeru – vocals Masato – guitar Yuji – guitar Chiyu – bass Shinpei – drums

[Website](http://remi-stargarnet.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Remi_Official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/remi_stargarnet/)

REMI is a female singer born in Tokyo, Japan. She is currently a member of [Sound Horizon](https://anilist.co/staff/100754/) and often works on [Yasuharu Takanashi](https://anilist.co/staff/100070)'s soundtracks.
Tyler Walker is an ADR Director, Script writer and voice actor for FUNimation.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/watawayuwaasa)

Originating from [Kaname Production](https://anilist.co/studio/288/).

Married to producer [Saburou Oomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/114329/).
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/久行宏和)
